courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Programming I
courses.Description: Introduces fundamental concepts of computing including memory, instructions, function calls, and activation records. Covers fundamentals of structured computer programming in the language of instruction: variables, input and output, expressions, assignment statements, conditionals and branching, subprograms, parameter passing, repetition, arrays, top-down design, testing, and debugging.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Programming II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="172" dept="CS" sect="060" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers object-oriented design, inheritance hierarchies, information hiding principles, string processing, recursion, good programming style, documentation, debugging, and testing.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to the basic principles of programming practice: testing, debugging, portability, performance, design alternatives, and style. Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. Introduction to tools used in the software development process for improving program functionality, performance, and robustness.

courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces formal logic and its connections to Computer Science. Students learn to translate statements about the behavior of computer programs into logical claims and to prove such assertions using both traditional techniques and automated tools. Considers approaches to proving termination, correctness, and safety for programs. Discusses propositional and predicate logic, logical inference, recursion and recursively defined sets, mathematical induction, and structural induction.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="CS" sect="003" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="060" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="062" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Section_Comments: Also register for one lab from 060-063

courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Serious Game Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="341" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The goal of this course is to learn more about serious games, that is games used in a non-entertainment context, such as games for health, education, and persuasion, through readings and through the design, development, and implementation of serious games.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="004" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Security
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="377" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines ways to avoid and correct programming flaws that lead to software security vulnerabilities in web applications, code implementation, user interfaces, use of cryptography, concurrency and exception handing. It also exposes students to testing processes that are specifically targeted to uncovering security flaws.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="380" dept="CS" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the foundations of artificial intelligence: production systems, heuristic programming, knowledge representation, and search algorithms. Also covers programming in an AI language. Additional topics chosen from game theory, decision support systems, pattern matching and recognition, image understanding, natural language, fuzzy and non-monotonic logic, machine learning, theorem proving, and common sense reasoning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="457" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers techniques for analyzing algorithms, including: elementary combinatorics, recurrence relations, and asymptotic analysis; data structures such as hash tables, red-black trees, B-trees, binomial and Fibonacci heaps, union-find trees; sorting algorithms and elementary graph algorithms.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Algorithmic Problem Solving
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on the application of algorithmic techniques toward solving specific problems and analyzing the solutions. The types of problems considered range from sorting and graph manipulation to string matching. Must also register for CS457.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="510" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Well-formed problems; state spaces and search spaces; Lisp and functional programming; uninformed search; heuristic search; stochastic search; knowledge representation; propositional logic; first order logic; predicate calculus; planning; partial order planning; hierarchical planning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Science Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="520" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Survey of basic mathematics concepts needed for the study of computer science at the graduate level: induction, iteration, recursion; analysis of program running time; graphs and trees; predicate logic; regular expressions, Context Free Grammars, and Turing Machines.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms I
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI & CYBR Majors
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="521" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Techniques for analyzing algorithms: asymptotic notation, recurrences, and correctness of algorithms; divide and conquer: quick sort, merge sort, median and order statistics; elementary data structures: hashing, binary heaps, binary search trees, balanced search trees; graph algorithms: Depth and Breadth first searches, connected components, minimum spanning trees, shortest paths in graphs.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Graphics
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="536" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An introduction to the basic concepts of computer graphics, including the graphics pipeline, 2D drawing, 3D viewing, mathematical representations of objects (lines, curves, surfaces and solids), color, and how these concepts are implemented.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: High Performance Computing
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="540" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers the design, evaluation and use of high-performance processors, including instruction set architecture, pipelining, superscalar execution, instruction level parallelism, vector instructions, memory hierarchy, parallel computing including multi-core and GPU, and high-performance I/O. Special attention is given to the effective utilization of these features, including automated techniques, in the design and optimization of performance-driven software.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Programming Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="570" dept="CS" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Develops an understanding of the principles behind and skill in the practice of programming. For both students with no programming experience and those with a small amount of programming experience, this course will bring them up to speed and prepare them for graduate study in Computer Science.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Science Principles
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="150" dept="CS" sect="063" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Programming I
courses.Description: Introduces fundamental concepts of computing including memory, instructions, function calls, and activation records. Covers fundamentals of structured computer programming in the language of instruction: variables, input and output, expressions, assignment statements, conditionals and branching, subprograms, parameter passing, repetition, arrays, top-down design, testing, and debugging.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Programming II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="172" dept="CS" sect="A" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers object-oriented design, inheritance hierarchies, information hiding principles, string processing, recursion, good programming style, documentation, debugging, and testing.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="CS" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to the basic principles of programming practice: testing, debugging, portability, performance, design alternatives, and style. Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. Introduction to tools used in the software development process for improving program functionality, performance, and robustness.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques

Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. Introduction to tools used in the software development process for improving program functionality, performance, and robustness.

courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques

Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="CS" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces formal logic and its connections to Computer Science. Students learn to translate statements about the behavior of computer programs into logical claims and to prove such assertions using both traditional techniques and automated tools. Considers approaches to proving termination, correctness, and safety for programs. Discusses propositional and predicate logic, logical inference, recursion and recursively defined sets, mathematical induction, and structural induction.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Web and Mobile App Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="275" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course introduces students to web-based and mobile development technologies and practices, including tiered application development, Service-Oriented Architectures and associated exchange protocols, and web-database programming. This course explores development and integration of web services from well-known providers as well as services created by the student, using a mobile platform as a vehicle for interactions with the services.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="061" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Section_Comments: Also register for one lab from 060-063
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="A" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Algorithmic Number Theory and Cryptography
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="303" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers fundamental algorithms for integer arithmetic, greatest common divisor calculation, modular arithmetic, and other number theoretic computations. Algorithms are derived, implemented and analyzed for primality testing and integer factorization. Applications to cryptography are explored including symmetric and public-key cryptosystems. A cryptosystem will be implemented and methods of attack investigated.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="003" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Concurrent Programming
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="361" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers programming of concurrent, cooperating sequential processes. Studies race conditions, critical sections, mutual exclusion, process synchronization, semaphores, monitors, message passing, the rendezvous, deadlock, and starvation.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="380" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the foundations of artificial intelligence: production systems, heuristic programming, knowledge representation, and search algorithms. Also covers programming in an AI language. Additional topics chosen from game theory, decision support systems, pattern matching and recognition, image understanding, natural language, fuzzy and non-monotonic logic, machine learning, theorem proving, and common sense reasoning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Graphics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="430" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course presents the fundamental geometric representations and drawing algorithms of computer graphics through lectures and programming assignments. The representations include lines, curves, splines, polygons, meshes, parametric surfaces and solids. The algorithms include line drawing, curve and surface evaluation, polygon filling, clipping, 3D-to-2D projection and hidden surface removal.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Networks: Theory, Applications and Programming
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="472" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to computer networking theory, applications and programming, focusing on large heterogeneous networks. Broad topdown introductions to computer networking concepts including distributed applications, socket programming, operation system and router support, router algorithms, and sending bits over congested, noisy and unreliable communication links.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="510" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Well-formed problems; state spaces and search spaces; Lisp and functional programming; uninformed search; heuristic search; stochastic search; knowledge representation; propositional logic; first order logic; predicate calculus; planning; partial order planning; hierarchical planning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Science Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="520" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Survey of basic mathematics concepts needed for the study of computer science at the graduate level: induction, iteration, recursion; analysis of program running time; graphs and trees; predicate logic; regular expressions, Context Free Grammars, and Turing Machines.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms I
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI & CYBR Majors
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="521" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Techniques for analyzing algorithms: asymptotic notation, recurrences, and correctness of algorithms; divide and conquer: quick sort, merge sort, median and order statistics; elementary data structures: hashing, binary heaps, binary search trees, balanced search trees; graph algorithms: Depth and Breadth first searches, connected components, minimum spanning trees, shortest paths in graphs.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Graphics
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="536" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An introduction to the basic concepts of computer graphics, including the graphics pipeline, 2D drawing, 3D viewing, mathematical representations of objects (lines, curves, surfaces and solids), color, and how these concepts are implemented.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: High Performance Computing
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for CCI students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="540" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers the design, evaluation and use of high-performance processors, including instruction set architecture, pipelining, superscalar execution, instruction level parallelism, vector instructions, memory hierarchy, parallel computing including multi-core and GPU, and high-performance I/O. Special attention is given to the effective utilization of these features, including automated techniques, in the design and optimization of performance-driven software.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Programming Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="570" dept="CS" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Develops an understanding of the principles behind and skill in the practice of programming. For both students with no programming experience and those with a small amount of programming experience, this course will bring them up to speed and prepare them for graduate study in Computer Science.

courses.Subject: CI
courses.Title: Computing and Informatics Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="CI" sect="060" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces computing and informatics through a combination of lectures and hands-on laboratory exercises. Lectures emphasize an integrated view of topic areas and systems, spanning low-level software and implementation issues to high-level use and acceptance by individuals and communities. Lab exercises allow students to explore familiar systems in unique and novel ways to better understand how these systems are designed and used.

courses.Subject: CI
courses.Title: Computing and Informatics Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="CI" sect="062" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces computing and informatics through a combination of lectures and hands-on laboratory exercises. Lectures emphasize an integrated view of topic areas and systems, spanning low-level software and implementation issues to high-level use and acceptance by individuals and communities. Lab exercises allow students to explore familiar systems in unique and novel ways to better understand how these systems are designed and used.

courses.Subject: CI
courses.Title: Computing and Informatics Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="CI" sect="064" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces computing and informatics through a combination of lectures and hands-on laboratory exercises. Lectures emphasize an integrated view of topic areas and systems, spanning low-level software and implementation issues to high-level use and acceptance by individuals and communities. Lab exercises allow students to explore familiar systems in unique and novel ways to better understand how these systems are designed and used.

Includes academic functions such as reflection papers, reading, and study skills, as well as co-curricular functions such as campus resources, activities, and social programs. Aids in the transition to student life at Drexel and is designed to help each student achieve academic and personal success through academic and career exploration.

courses.Subject: CI
courses.Title: Senior Project I
courses.Section_Comments: Placeholder - Students will be moved to specific sections
courses.Description: Part of a multi-term capstone experience involving in-depth study and application of computing and informatics. Students work in teams to develop a significant product. Requires use of a development process that includes planning, specification, design, implementation, evaluation, and documentation. This course is writing intensive.

courses.Subject: HSM
courses.Title: Emergency Incident Risk Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="645" dept="HSM" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on risk management skills used by first responders to emergency incidents.  Particular attention will be paid to the emergency operations systems of the Philadelphia police and fire departments in conjunction with the Managing Director¿s Office of Emergency Management.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Specification and Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Study of the principles, practices, and techniques used to gather system requirements and document them in a requirements specification. Includes techniques for requirements discovery such as user interviews and prototyping. Introduces approaches for organizing and expressing software requirements in a requirements specification.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Architecture I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="SE" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Study of macro-level software system architectures with an emphasis on approaches to interconnection and distribution of current and emerging architectural styles.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Architecture I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="SE" sect="004" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Study of macro-level software system architectures with an emphasis on approaches to interconnection and distribution of current and emerging architectural styles.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Verification and Validation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="SE" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Presents theory and practice of software testing. Covers structural testing including such topics as path testing, dataflow testing, logic based testing, syntax testing, program slicing, mutation testing, fault injection, program perturbation, and testing tools. Discusses techniques for test construction and test suite evaluation, and validation against requirements and design models. Also covers methods of inspection and review at various phases of the software lifecycle.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="575" dept="SE" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides fundamental knowledge of software design and management. Topics include software design principles, abstraction and modularization, hierarchical structures and software families, design modeling and analysis, pattern-oriented design, and technical debts. The course strikes a balance between teaching principles of software design and analysis, and providing a basis for understanding cutting-edge techniques and concepts, using open source projects as case studies.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Requirements Engineering and Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="627" dept="SE" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides students with an opportunity to explore and experience methodologies, tools, and techniques for eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and managing requirements in modern software development organizations. Focuses on the intersection of requirements engineering, strategic IS and business planning, and business process reengineering. Students will also learn about change management in in the context of requirements engineering. Upon completion of the course, each student should have new skills and insights that are immediately applicable to the performance of the requirements engineering project function.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Project Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="638" dept="SE" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Focuses on first-line management of software system development. Covers major themes including estimation (software cost factors, estimation models, and risk management), planning (work breakdown, scheduling, staffing, resource allocation, and creation of a project plan), and execution (team building, leadership, motivation, process tracking, control recovery, and communication within and outside the project).

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Studio
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="691" dept="SE" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a multi-term integrative experience involving application of software engineering tools and techniques. Students work in teams to develop or contribute to large-scale software products.  Requires participation in a development process that includes planning, specification, design, implementation, evaluation, and documentation.

courses.Title: Software Architecture I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Title: Software Verification and Validation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Presents theory and practice of software testing. Covers structural testing including such topics as path testing, dataflow testing, logic based testing, syntax testing, program slicing, mutation testing, fault injection, program perturbation, and testing tools. Discusses techniques for test construction and test suite evaluation, and validation against requirements and design models. Also covers methods of inspection and review at various phases of the software lifecycle.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="575" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides fundamental knowledge of software design and management. Topics include software design principles, abstraction and modularization, hierarchical structures and software families, design modeling and analysis, pattern-oriented design, and technical debts. The course strikes a balance between teaching principles of software design and analysis, and providing a basis for understanding cutting-edge techniques and concepts, using open source projects as case studies.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Requirements Engineering and Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="627" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides students with an opportunity to explore and experience methodologies, tools, and techniques for eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and managing requirements in modern software development organizations. Focuses on the intersection of requirements engineering, strategic IS and business planning, and business process reengineering. Students will also learn about change management in in the context of requirements engineering. Upon completion of the course, each student should have new skills and insights that are immediately applicable to the performance of the requirements engineering project function.

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Project Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="638" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Focuses on first-line management of software system development. Covers major themes including estimation (software cost factors, estimation models, and risk management), planning (work breakdown, scheduling, staffing, resource allocation, and creation of a project plan), and execution (team building, leadership, motivation, process tracking, control recovery, and communication within and outside the project).

courses.Subject: SE
courses.Title: Software Studio
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="691" dept="SE" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a multi-term integrative experience involving application of software engineering tools and techniques. Students work in teams to develop or contribute to large-scale software products.  Requires participation in a development process that includes planning, specification, design, implementation, evaluation, and documentation.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Network Administration I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="140" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students gain an understanding of terminology, technology, and issues involved in implementing networks. Topic include: understanding the OSI 7 layer model; concepts of servers and clients; network hardware/software functions; basics of TCP/IP protocol, main types of network topologies (bus, ring, star and mesh); and share and access network resources (files, printers, etc.).

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Server I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics include advanced PC hardware and server issues, including RAID, SCSI, troubleshooting and problem determination, upgrading, configuration, and disaster recovery. The second part of this course is an introduction to Apache Server concepts. Topics include: installations, configuration and administration in environments such as Windows and Linux.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Information Technology Security I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys information security topics; familiarizes students with the technologies and policies that support confidentiality, integrity and availability.  Industry standards for security architecture, operational security, policy and governance are covered and provides the foundations for further study of information security.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Open Server I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces administration of open source operating systems and management of open servers. Topics covered include the boot process and fundamental server concepts related to processing, memory and storage. Addresses use of a command line interface to manage processes, modify file permissions, examine configuration settings, and run utilities for server administration.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Computer Forensics I: Fundamentals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="212" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course presents the theory, methodology and hands-on labs necessary for students to become competent in the basics of computer forensics.  Topics covered include: understanding computer investigations, the investigators, laboratory, current forensics tools, digital evidence controls and processing crime.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Access Control and Intrusion Detection Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="312" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Fundamental theory and methodology of intrusion detection systems.  Using intrusion detection systems to secure corporate and personal networks against attacks.   Hands-on laboratory experience using an in-depth, open-source network intrusion detection system.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Disaster Recovery and Continuity Planning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="415" dept="CT" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Disaster Recovery & Continuity Planning specific to Emergency Recovery Procedures.   Techniques for development of disaster recovery plans, procedures and testing methods.   Strategies used by businesses to assure that sensitive data will not be lost in the event of a disaster.   Techniques used to manage potential risk within multiple environments.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Network Administration I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="140" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Topic include: understanding the OSI 7 layer model; concepts of servers and clients; network hardware/software functions; basics of TCP/IP protocol, main types of network topologies (bus, ring, star and mesh); and share and access network resources (files, printers, etc.).

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Server I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

The second part of this course is an introduction to Apache Server concepts. Topics include: installations, configuration and administration in environments such as Windows and Linux.

courses.Title: Information Technology Security I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Industry standards for security architecture, operational security, policy and governance are covered and provides the foundations for further study of information security.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Open Server I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces administration of open source operating systems and management of open servers. Topics covered include the boot process and fundamental server concepts related to processing, memory and storage. Addresses use of a command line interface to manage processes, modify file permissions, examine configuration settings, and run utilities for server administration.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Computer Forensics I: Fundamentals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="212" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course presents the theory, methodology and hands-on labs necessary for students to become competent in the basics of computer forensics. Topics covered include: understanding computer investigations, the investigators, laboratory, current forensics tools, digital evidence controls and processing crime.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Network Auditing Tools
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="362" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Theory, methodology and hands-on labs relating to Network Auditing.  The course relies on advanced multi-functional network auditing tools to uncover Network Security problems, with the purpose of eliminating these vulnerabilities.

courses.Subject: CT
courses.Title: Disaster Recovery and Continuity Planning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="415" dept="CT" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Disaster Recovery & Continuity Planning specific to Emergency Recovery Procedures.   Techniques for development of disaster recovery plans, procedures and testing methods.   Strategies used by businesses to assure that sensitive data will not be lost in the event of a disaster.   Techniques used to manage potential risk within multiple environments.

courses.Subject: DSCI
courses.Title: Data Acquisition and Pre-Processing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="511" dept="DSCI" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the breadth of data science through a project lifecycle perspective. Covers early-stage data-life cycle activities in depth for the development and dissemination of data sets. Provides technical experience with data harvesting, acquisition, pre-processing, and curation.  Concludes with an open-ended term project where students explore data availability, scale, variability, and reliability.

courses.Subject: DSCI
courses.Title: Data Acquisition and Pre-Processing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="511" dept="DSCI" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the breadth of data science through a project lifecycle perspective. Covers early-stage data-life cycle activities in depth for the development and dissemination of data sets. Provides technical experience with data harvesting, acquisition, pre-processing, and curation.  Concludes with an open-ended term project where students explore data availability, scale, variability, and reliability.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the basic knowledge and techniques required to use computing effectively in organizations. Explores information systems, information technology and software concepts with an emphasis on how computing can be used to help organizations meet their goals.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="004" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the infrastructure that makes current information and communication technology possible. Introduces foundational concepts of servers, networks, databases, and the Web. Addresses security and usability considerations that cut across all computing technology. Approaches computing technology from the perspective of system administrators who plan, manage, operate, and monitor large scale computing infrastructure. Covers emerging technologies including pervasive computing, continuous integration, virtualization, and the Internet of things. Explores professional opportunities in this high demand area.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="901" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="903" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
