courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="CS" sect="002" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces formal logic and its connections to Computer Science. Students learn to translate statements about the behavior of computer programs into logical claims and to prove such assertions using both traditional techniques and automated tools. Considers approaches to proving termination, correctness, and safety for programs. Discusses propositional and predicate logic, logical inference, recursion and recursively defined sets, mathematical induction, and structural induction.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="061" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="063" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="B" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="002" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Concurrent Programming
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="361" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers programming of concurrent, cooperating sequential processes. Studies race conditions, critical sections, mutual exclusion, process synchronization, semaphores, monitors, message passing, the rendezvous, deadlock, and starvation.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="380" dept="CS" sect="002" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the foundations of artificial intelligence: production systems, heuristic programming, knowledge representation, and search algorithms. Also covers programming in an AI language. Additional topics chosen from game theory, decision support systems, pattern matching and recognition, image understanding, natural language, fuzzy and non-monotonic logic, machine learning, theorem proving, and common sense reasoning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Theory of Computation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="440" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Finite automata, regular sets, and regular expressions; pushdown automata, context-free languages, and normal forms for grammars; Turing machines and recursively enumerable sets; Chomsky hierarchy; computability theory.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Database Systems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="461" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers topics including structure and function of database systems, normal form theory, data models (relational, network, and hierarchical), query processing (ISBL), relational algebra and calculus, and file structures. Includes programming project using DBMS.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer and Network Security
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="475" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The key objective of this course is to provide a thorough understanding of technologies and methodologies with which computer networks can be protected. Topics that are covered include: key management and credentials, steganography and watermarking, networking security (VPNs, firewalls, intrusion detection) and system security policies.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Test Driven Dev & eXtreme Prog
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="CS" sect="003" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Fundamentals of Databases
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="500" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course gives an introduction to data management at scale.  Covered topics include ER and relational modeling, SQL, database application development, query processing, and data management on distributed platforms.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Science Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="520" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Survey of basic mathematics concepts needed for the study of computer science at the graduate level: induction, iteration, recursion; analysis of program running time; graphs and trees; predicate logic; regular expressions, Context Free Grammars, and Turing Machines.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Theory of Computation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="525" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Theory of computation introduces basic mathematical models of computation and the finite representation of infinite objects. These topics covered in the course include: finite automata and regular languages, context free languages, Turning machines, Partial recursive functions, Church's Thesis, undecidability, reducibility and completeness, and time complexity.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Networks
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="544" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: To examine computer networks using networking models (TCP/IP, OSI and ATM) and break down computer networking, examine each layer and its duties and responsibilities. To analyze networking protocols and understand the design. To use the Internet and other example protocols to illustrate the theory and operation of each layer.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Programming Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="570" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Develops an understanding of the principles behind and skill in the practice of programming. For both students with no programming experience and those with a small amount of programming experience, this course will bring them up to speed and prepare them for graduate study in Computer Science.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Introduction to Computer Vision
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="583" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Theoretical and algorithmic foundation and applications of computer vision. Covered topics include image formation, image sensing, image filtering, lightness, radiometry, motion, image registration, stereo, photometric stereo, shape-from-shading, and recognition with an emphasis on the underlying mathematics and computational models and complexity as well as computational implementation of representative applications through multiple programming assignments.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Algorithmic Game Theory
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="618" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores, from an algorithmic perspective, problems that arise at the interface of economics and computer science. After a short introduction to game theory, the focus will be on understanding how the incentives of strategic agents may affect these agents¿ decisions, and on designing mechanisms aiming to improve the outcomes of the interactions among the agents. The topics covered include the design of auctions, matching markets, online advertising markets, fair division, selfish routing, social choice, and preference aggregation.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Distributed Systems Software
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="647" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: In-depth discussion of fundamental concepts of distributed computer systems. Covers development techniques and runtime challenges, with a focus on reliability and system validation techniques. Subjects discussed include: interprocess communication, remote procedure calls and method invocation, middleware, distributed services, coordination, transactions, replication and weak data consistency models. Significant system-building term project in Java or similar language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Test Driven Dev & eXtreme Prog
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T780" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A course on software production with the emphasis on software quality, mainstream development methodology, and state-of-the-art frameworks. This course was built with the help of Agile Manifesto founders, software industry authors, consultants, trainers, and pedagogy experts, using Java systems to demonstrate TDD & XP.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Programming I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="171" dept="CS" sect="061" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces fundamental concepts of computing including memory, instructions, function calls, and activation records. Covers fundamentals of structured computer programming in the language of instruction: variables, input and output, expressions, assignment statements, conditionals and branching, subprograms, parameter passing, repetition, arrays, top-down design, testing, and debugging.

courses.Title: Computer Programming I

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Data Structures
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="260" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers stacks, queues, linked allocation, binary trees, internal searching and sorting, hashing, and applications.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="CS" sect="002" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to the basic principles of programming practice: testing, debugging, portability, performance, design alternatives, and style. Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. Introduction to tools used in the software development process for improving program functionality, performance, and robustness.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Advanced Programming Tools and Techniques
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="CS" sect="004" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to the basic principles of programming practice: testing, debugging, portability, performance, design alternatives, and style. Application in a variety of programming languages, programming environments, and operating systems. Introduction to tools used in the software development process for improving program functionality, performance, and robustness.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces formal logic and its connections to Computer Science. Students learn to translate statements about the behavior of computer programs into logical claims and to prove such assertions using both traditional techniques and automated tools. Considers approaches to proving termination, correctness, and safety for programs. Discusses propositional and predicate logic, logical inference, recursion and recursively defined sets, mathematical induction, and structural induction.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Web and Mobile App Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="275" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course introduces students to web-based and mobile development technologies and practices, including tiered application development, Service-Oriented Architectures and associated exchange protocols, and web-database programming. This course explores development and integration of web services from well-known providers as well as services created by the student, using a mobile platform as a vehicle for interactions with the services.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="062" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Systems Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="281" dept="CS" sect="A" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers internal function and organization of digital computers, including instruction sets, addressing methods, input-output architectures, central processor organization, machine language, and assembly language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Software Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="CS" sect="003" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers software design methods and implementation. Good design and implementation approaches will be motivated through software examples and reinforced through programming projects. Topics include architectural styles, code reuse, modularity and information hiding principles, object-oriented design patterns, design specification and formal methods, good coding and documentation practices. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="380" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the foundations of artificial intelligence: production systems, heuristic programming, knowledge representation, and search algorithms. Also covers programming in an AI language. Additional topics chosen from game theory, decision support systems, pattern matching and recognition, image understanding, natural language, fuzzy and non-monotonic logic, machine learning, theorem proving, and common sense reasoning.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computational Photography
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="435" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Fundamentals of computational photography, an interdisciplinary field at the intersection of computer vision, graphics, and photography. Covered topics include fundamentals of cameras, novel camera designs, image manipulation, single-view modeling, and image-based rendering with an emphasis on learning the computational methods and their underlying mathematical concepts through hands-on assignments.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="458" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course presents algorithm design techniques such as dynamic programming, greedy methods, divide and conquer, amortized algorithms; more graph algorithms for minimum spanning trees, shortest paths, and network flows; string matching algorithms; algorithms for finding the convex hull of a discrete set of points; NP-Completeness and approximation algorithms.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Networks: Theory, Applications and Programming
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="472" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to computer networking theory, applications and programming, focusing on large heterogeneous networks. Broad topdown introductions to computer networking concepts including distributed applications, socket programming, operation system and router support, router algorithms, and sending bits over congested, noisy and unreliable communication links.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computational Music
courses.Instructor: Jeffrey L Popyack, Luke A Abruzzo
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="CS" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Fundamentals of representing, manipulating, analyzing and creating music through computation. Topics include: basic music theory, the mathematics and physics of sound, digital music formats, hardware, software and algorithms for music computation, musical instruments and synthesizers. Prerequisite CS260. A background in music will be helpful but is not required.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Test Driven Dev & eXtreme Prog
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="CS" sect="903" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Fundamentals of Databases
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="500" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course gives an introduction to data management at scale.  Covered topics include ER and relational modeling, SQL, database application development, query processing, and data management on distributed platforms.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Science Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="520" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Survey of basic mathematics concepts needed for the study of computer science at the graduate level: induction, iteration, recursion; analysis of program running time; graphs and trees; predicate logic; regular expressions, Context Free Grammars, and Turing Machines.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Theory of Computation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="525" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Theory of computation introduces basic mathematical models of computation and the finite representation of infinite objects.  These topics covered in the course include: finite automata and regular languages, context free languages, Turning machines, Partial recursive functions, Church's Thesis, undecidability, reducibility and completeness, and time complexity.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Computer Networks
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="544" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: To examine computer networks using networking models (TCP/IP, OSI and ATM) and break down computer networking, examine each layer and its duties and responsibilities. To analyze networking protocols and understand the design. To use the Internet and other example protocols to illustrate the theory and operation of each layer.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Programming Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="570" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Develops an understanding of the principles behind and skill in the practice of programming.  For both students with no programming experience and those with a small amount of programming experience, this course will bring them up to speed and prepare them for graduate study in Computer Science.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Introduction to Computer Vision
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="583" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Theoretical and algorithmic foundation and applications of computer vision. Covered topics include image formation, image sensing, image filtering, lightness, radiometry, motion, image registration, stereo, photometric stereo, shape-from-shading, and recognition with an emphasis on the underlying mathematics and computational models and complexity as well as computational implementation of representative applications through multiple programming assignments.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Algorithmic Game Theory
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="618" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores, from an algorithmic perspective, problems that arise at the interface of economics and computer science. After a short introduction to game theory, the focus will be on understanding how the incentives of strategic agents may affect these agents¿ decisions, and on designing mechanisms aiming to improve the outcomes of the interactions among the agents. The topics covered include the design of auctions, matching markets, online advertising markets, fair division, selfish routing, social choice, and preference aggregation.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Distributed Systems Software
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="647" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: In-depth discussion of fundamental concepts of distributed computer systems. Covers development techniques and runtime challenges, with a focus on reliability and system validation techniques. Subjects discussed include: interprocess communication, remote procedure calls and method invocation, middleware, distributed services, coordination, transactions, replication and weak data consistency models. Significant system-building term project in Java or similar language.

courses.Subject: CS
courses.Title: Test Driven Dev & eXtreme Prog
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T780" dept="CS" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A course on software production with the emphasis on software quality, mainstream development methodology, and state-of-the-art frameworks. This course was built with the help of Agile Manifesto founders, software industry authors, consultants, trainers, and pedagogy experts, using Java systems to demonstrate TDD & XP.

courses.Subject: CI
courses.Title: Computing and Informatics Design III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="CI" sect="061" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Follows CI 102 in the Computing & Informatics design sequence. Introduces computing and informatics through a combination of lectures and hands-on laboratory exercises. Lectures emphasize an integrated view of topic areas and systems, spanning low-level software and implementation issues to high-level use and acceptance by individuals and communities. Lab exercises allow students to explore familiar systems in unique and novel ways to better understand how these systems are designed and used.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the infrastructure that makes current information and communication technology possible. Introduces foundational concepts of servers, networks, databases, and the Web. Addresses security and usability considerations that cut across all computing technology. Approaches computing technology from the perspective of system administrators who plan, manage, operate, and monitor large scale computing infrastructure. Covers emerging technologies including pervasive computing, continuous integration, virtualization, and the Internet of things. Explores professional opportunities in this high demand area.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Addresses security and usability considerations that cut across all computing technology. Covers emerging technologies including pervasive computing, continuous integration, virtualization, and the Internet of things. Explores professional opportunities in this high demand area.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Information Systems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="102" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces students to major types of information systems and their development and their use in organizations. Emphasizes ways in which information systems can be used to help individuals and organizations meet their goals. Assumes basic knowledge of computing concepts.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Data Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="INFO" sect="002" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A first course in data science. Introduces data science as a field, describes the roles and services that various members of the community play and the life cycle of data science projects. Provides an overview of common types of data, where they come from, and the challenges that practitioners face in the modern world of ¿Big Data.¿ Provides an introduction to the interdisciplinary mixture of skills that the practice requires.

courses.Subject: INFO
courses.Title: Introduction to Data Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="INFO" sect="004" term="S19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
